channel.title: Error In client.java

item.title: Error In client.java
item.dc:creator: @new new
item.description:
@new wrote:

When compiling i get the error:

Found JDK 1.6.0_02 Results: client.java:6106: illegal start of expression public void debug(String text) { ^ 1 error Done!

I am using a devolution server base. i have looked in client.java for where it says the problem is and i cannot find anything wrong, but im new at this, so i might be overlooking something. This is the only appearence of “public void debug” in client.java:

	public void debug(String text) {
		if (debug)
			sendMessage(text);
	}

I don’t think i have edited this at all since i downloaded the server, and it appeared after i edited a command. If i just add a “//'s” before every line in it so the program doesnt do anything with the lines of code, it says the same error with the next “public void ____” I’m not fully sure what this code even does, so if anyone could help me with either of these, i would greatly appreciate it. :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 14, 2008, 11:32:40 pm[/size][hr]Surely someone must know something about this? please
